intro: Oldenlandia pinifolia var. macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered mistletoe, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. It typically grows as an epiphyte or a hemi-epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and shrubs in its natural habitat. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems where it is found.
